intro: Crucihimalaya stricta, commonly known as the Himalayan crucifix, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Crucihimalaya stricta is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas.
